0.Pros: there are no pros at all
0.Cons: had the job for a little over a month and i quit because they wouldnt work with me im in school

1.Pros: - 50% discount on everything on the menu except the value menu- Good job to start off at to get experience
1.Cons: - Co-Workers were awful and mean- I wasn't trained at all! I learned by myself and still I didn't even know what I was doing because I wasn't doing them the right way due to not being trained.- every time I asked for help or to be trained on something they would laugh at me or ignore me.- we were always short staffed

2.Pros: You are able to experience what it is to have a first job, and I look forward to using what I learned there in the future.
2.Cons: If you do not like dealing with waves of customers coming in and out, this would not be a good place for you to work.

3.Pros: Lots of learning experience involved at a fast pace.
3.Cons: Have to keep on them about wanting to switch to service even then they probably wont switch you.

4.Pros: Great environment, flexible schedule, room for growth
4.Cons: No benefits, no overtime pay, salary is poor.

6.Pros: I worked with great people that became good friends! I enjoyed the fast paced work routine.
6.Cons: Not enough pay and no benefits

7.Pros: Flexible for college students seeking a few extra income.
7.Cons: Schedules are not fixed and are changing on a weekly bases.

8.Pros: Good food, great taste, good pricess.
8.Cons: Bad for your health, but I don't care.

9.Pros: community, fun, student advancement. Customer service
